docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 18--President Truman sent to the Senate today the nomination of Paul V. McNutt to be our first Ambassador to the Philippines after independence is achieved on July 4.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 18--President Truman sent to the Senate today the nomination of Paul V. McNutt to be our first Ambassador to the Philippines after independence is achieved on July 4.
docs.abstract: to represent Truman at PI independence ceremonies

headline.main: M'NUTT IS PROPOSED AS ENVOY TO ISLANDS

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 19--Herbert Hoover, honorary chairman of President Truman's Famine Emergency Committee, reported today that he had found additional food for hungry lands as the result of "excellent, cooperation" from Latin America.

docs.abstract: Hoover repts Govt will reduce imports

byline.original: By BENJAMIN FINE Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Activity in the foreign exchange market during the past week was confined to routine transactions. Volume of business was small and price movements were narrow. Canadian free dollar was easier while the pound sterling was firm.
docs.lead_paragraph: Activity in the foreign exchange market during the past week was confined to routine transactions. Volume of business was small and price movements were narrow. Canadian free dollar was easier while the pound sterling was firm.

docs.snippet: The work of reconverting the Moore-McCormack liner Uruguay to her peacetime status as part of the company's "Good Neighbor Fleet" has been awarded to the Kearny yard of the Federal Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company, which was the low bidder at ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The work of reconverting the Moore-McCormack liner Uruguay to her peacetime status as part of the company's "Good Neighbor Fleet" has been awarded to the Kearny yard of the Federal Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company, which was the low bidder at $4,437,000. The job is expected to be completed in eight months.
docs.abstract: Fed Shipbldg & Drydock Co to reconvert SS Uruguay

docs.snippet: An exhibition of books and posters from Argentina and Uruguay, collected by Edward Larocque Tinker, will be shown in Room 213, New York Public Library, Fifth Avenue and Fortysecond Street, beginning Tuesday. It will be open until late summer.
